column2: Even though this character had a particularly mediocre childhood, they were thrust into the limelight overnight, and they didn't even have to be go through all the trouble of killing snakes and reading books.
This character had their age shifted, and as a result their diplomatic skills have suffered greatly.
The Dungeon Master, mighty dice roller and occasional controller of destiny.
This character has the Midas Plague, a terrifying affliction which slowly turns the infected into solid gold!
This character is an ancient king risen again to reclaim the lands lost to the ravages of time.
This is a perfectly normal man, despite what you believe. Would you rather this said 'Genius' or 'Proud', I don't understand, it's just a regular guy.
This character was selected as the super seducer, a man destined to father a thousand children, or, perhaps, just as many as the game can handle without crashing.
This man spends his time painting happy little trees and lulling those around him into a deep, comfortable sleep with his voice.

This character is blessed with a towering intellect.
Martial: ùG+5ù!
Intrigue: ùG+5ù!
Diplomacy: ùG+5ù!
Stewardship: ùG+5ù!
Learning: ùG+5ù!
Personal Combat Skill: ùG+10ù!
Vassal Opinion: ùG+5ù!
This character has made a pact with Death, and is fated to not live beyond a specific date.
This character accepted a dark gift and succumbed to its temptations...
Dungeon Mastery is the ancient and formidable art of manipulating the luck of the foolhardy into interesting and cruel outcomes.
This Gary has ascended. He is no longer Gary. He is... GARY.

This province has been struck with the Midas Plague - an incredibly deadly disease that either leaves the afflicted horribly maimed by only transforming extremities, or spreads from the torso until it leaves a statue of solid gold.
withered after being separated from their cursed ring
After a run-in with the Dungeon Master, this city found itself built on the sight of inexhaustible gold mines, and a deadly and terrible disease.
The mythical Fountain of Youth was discovered in the foundations of a temple in this very province. Naturally, the ruler of the province takes a great interest in such a find...
This is one of the nine cursed rings given out by the Dungeon Master's good friend to the mortal rulers of kingdoms.
A strange glowing ring owned by the Dungeon Master, it bears a striking resemblance to the other cursed rings.
This is a fish, you could potentially hit people with it, or use it as a makeshift mining tool, but it has feelings too.

From a distance this armour looks to be oddly coloured chainmail, until you get close enough to realise that it is simply fish scales, haphazardly crafted to mimic the appearance of chainmail, with absolutely none of the benefits.
Not to be confused with a trilby, the fedora is a symbol of adventure and pairs great with a whip. Warning: keep out of reach of creepy virgin men.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble gives mastery over the minds of yourself and others.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble gives the user unrivaled physical power.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble gives the user control over tangible objects, such as gold or stone.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble gives the user domination of their very own soul.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble gives the user the ability to manipulate the space around them.
One of the six Eternity Pebbles. This Pebble grants the user the power to guide time itself.
Will remove ùRStressedù!, ùRDepressedù!, ùRLunaticù!, or ùRPossessedù!!
Has Previously Resisted The Ring's Influence
For 12 months everyone has decided to turn a blind eye to crimes and atrocities.
For some strange reason, this person seems to have some extremely skilled defenders.
This character decided that health was more important than appearances.
After a spar day this character decided that sometimes looking good is better than feeling good.
This character was given a cat as a pet by the Dungeon Master.
This character was given a dog as a pet by the Dungeon Master.
This character was given a snake as a pet by the Dungeon Master.
This character was given a bear as a pet by the Dungeon Master. Yes, really.
This character was given a pony as a pet by the Dungeon Master.
This character was given a hamster as a pet by the Dungeon Master. Not a miniature giant space hamster, sadly, just a normal hamster.
This character was given a rat as a pet by the Dungeon Master.
This character has made a deal with Death.
This character has made a deal with Death.
This character has made a deal with Death.
This character can doot the horn once while in combat to almost immediately route the enemy.\nOr they can save it. Who knows what might happen?
The Dungeon Master will awaken. Every 15 years he will present the world with an event ranging from amusing to downright catastrophic.
Tell Name to the Dungeon Master
You can speak this characters name to the Dungeon Master, who in turn will write their name in the Murder Book, resulting in the characters death. There family wont be best pleased by this...
Use Get Out of Jail Free Card
Use the Get Out of Jail Free Card given to you by the Dungeon Master to guarantee your freedom. Warning: This is a single-use item and will be consumed!
The Dungeon Master has graced you with the ability to kidnap [Root.GetFirstName] and force [Root.GetHerHim] into your dynasty.\nYou can perform this action only once. Choose wisely.
Ask not for whom the horn doots. It doots for thee.
So small, and so shiny - it's precious to me.
Remove the Cursed Ring and stop it gnawing at your will and reason.
Dragon deez nuts across your face! Ha! Gottem!

Mortals, it is time once again for my influence to help shape this world! Brace yourself for the mediocre, or the insane. The unbalanced, or the overpowered!\nRandom Number of the Day is: [global_eventTombola.GetValue]
In ùGMultiplayerù!, one player will be the messenger of the Dungeon Master, this will be the player that fires the decision.
ùRWarningù!: The first event will fire immediately, be prepared!
All ùGPhysicalù! and ùGMental illnessesù! will be cured!
All ùGGenetic Abnormalitiesù! will be removed!

Well, well, well, this is not quite right is it?\nAmerica? That's going to stop things working properly. Not my jurisdiction you see. Already enough chaos there to last a life time. Look, I can offer you the usual chaos, here and there, but that's it.
Certain events have been disabled to allow for compatibility with After the Ends wacky Empire mechanics!

Greetings players of the game, I am the Dungeon Master, guider of destiny and occasional roller of dice. What a boring player - you're playing the regular game this time around I see? I have adjusted the dice rolls and outcomes to fit a base game map, or at least a map that is fairly close to that. Good luck...

Greetings players of the game, I am the Dungeon Master, guider of destiny and occasional roller of dice.\nA contrarian not happy with the base game? Fine. I have adjusted the dice rolls and outcomes to fit your total conversion mod, or at least a map that is fairly close to that. Good luck...

I've recently concocted a new potion! cries the Dungeon Master, "Okay, fine, it's my bathwater - but I've been told it's incredibly potent stuff! I call it "Gamer Guy Bathwater" and my favourite game is getting you all to take a sip!"
All landed rulers become Lustful Hedonists.

It's no secret that the Dungeon Master, like most Dungeon Masters, is an incredibly lonely and isolated man, living out his fantasies by controlling the lives of characters all day for his sadistic enjoyment. "I just wish I could have a family of my own..." says the Dungeon Master with a solemn sigh, "Wait a minute! That's it! Oh, ladies!"
What do you mean 'he called it his special move'!?
All married ruler's wives become mysteriously pregnant.

Sometimes it's not fun being the only omnipotent immortal being in this realm, well besides all those characters that conveniently became immortal gods through some convoluted event chain. Anyway, let's sprinkle some more deus ex machina out there and see what chaos they can cause!
This is the end of civilisation as we know it...
Twenty rulers ascend to become Immortal rulers of Destiny, who are rivals with one another.

You mortals, always growing old and dying and having your children cry or complain about whatever the hell 'gavelkind' is, it's such a dull affair - let's speed it up! Or reverse it! Now if I could get some volunteers... how about you, with the fancy hat!
Fetch a priest... or a doctor! Or both!
Kings ages will adjust randomly anywhere between minus 30 to plus 30 years of age. Affected characters will be given the ùRAge Shiftedù! trait.

You with your fancy chairs and castles, you make rules for other people and don't follow them yourselves! It makes me sick, playing with peoples lives like that. Well we're taking away the rules, morality is out the window. Do whatever you want, good luck with your squishy moral existence now it's an equal playing field!
You're telling me people have just... stopped caring?
All landed rules have become morally flexible, ùGarrestsù! and ùGplotsù! will be far easier for the next year!

This is gonna be sweet mutters the Dungeon Master as he clicks his fingers. Reports of rulers drastically shrinking, becoming stubborn, and gaining the uncanny ability of defence become known far and wide. No one quite understands why.
These bastions of short men make for formidable defenders.
Some lucky rulers lose height but make up for it in their defensive skills.

The greatest mystery of all! proclaims the Dungeon Master "Long ago my brother died horribly in a fish related incident, and as the river became stained with his blood he cried out "RENDERER THIGH!" and still to this day I have no idea what the hell he was talking about. For whoever solves the challenge of the Renderer Thigh, I will grant you a gift beyond even those of your wildest dreams and fantasies!"
Sometimes I think I am far too cruel. Today is your lucky day my friend, to you I give the greatest gift of all. It might help you against some of my... other plans.
You sense a great adventure approaching...
You hear cackling off in the distance...
I have a friend I want to introduce you to begins the Dungeon Master "He is very dear to me, and very very skilled with alchemy. I think you'll both get along well!"
This could be useful, I am going into battle...

You know, I didn't actually train to be a Dungeon Master until late into my 600s, before then I was a maths teacher, but I didn't want to be that cruel my entire life. I think you all deserve a second chance as well!
All rulers gain a second education.
One my favourite movies, begins the Dungeon Master, "is Lethal weapon two. Anyway, I'm flipping all your sexes, enjoy!"
All landed rulers flip sex, forever.

I get a strange feeling that some of you really like going out there and killing each other just for the sport of it. Well all good sports deserve a trophy! Whoever holds [battle_royale.GetName] by the end of 6 years will be given a prize worthy of such bloodshed!
All rulers are given a claim on [battle_royale.GetName] and whoever holds the province after six years have elapsed will be granted massive amounts of gold, prestige, and piety!

Does it not get boring sitting around in your big fancy castle, with all your nice furniture, and your nice servants speaking your nice language? asks the Dungeon Master, "You need to try something different! Spice up your life a little!"
Rulers selected at random will have their capital swapped with another random ruler!

I know a guy, a really good guy, a great friend of mine... says the Dungeon Master, peering over his shoulder as if he's expecting someone, "And I sort of owe him. In exchange for not interrupting with my meddling, I promised I'd help him out with a small thing that's been bothering him a few... thousand years. A small, popey, problem..."
You're saying they've all gone a bit strange?
All religious heads seems to fall under a strange influence...

I've been working on a machine in my spare time, it's nothing too impressive, just do me a favour and put your face on it... right there, that's it! Now you might feel a slight tingle in your nervous system...
All positive congenital traits become negative congenital traits, and vice versa!

I've been doing some MORE science recently, and I have discovered that actually [religion_proven.GetName] is probably right! I can't guarantee it, but I've just casually slid the important documents under every rulers door. It's up to them what they do with it - I'm not their mother.
My god, he's gone completely mad...

Rumours have always persisted around [lost_province_of_gold.GetName] speaking of the lost city of gold, but many dismissed it as the dreams of a desperately poor people. The Dungeon Master, feeling a great pity for the people in [lost_city_of_gold.GetName] decided to make all of their dreams come true and transformed the whole city, including it's foundations, and natural resources, into solid gold!\nUnfortunately, the tricky caused by the Dungeon Master had an unintended side effect - people were randomly turning to gold and infecting others with the same curse!
To own such a city... but the risk is too great!
Random characters have a chance of turning into solid gold.
The owner of [lost_city_of_gold.GetName] will be tremendously wealthy.

I'm friends with a great jeweler, he's quite a tame guy by my standards, but he has a real talent when it comes to making rings - pretty generous too! He gave me a whole bunch of rings to hand out to lucky people! I'll see if I have one for you here.
This doesn't sound suspicious in the least!

I've been doing a bit of poking around and at the bottom of a lake I found a age-old container filled to the brim with religious texts! I have no idea who put those there but, in my usually helpful nature, I've decided to forward a copy to the relevant religious heads so they can study and make the changes that their religion must have conveniently forgotten about!
We have to do WHAT now?!
Random religions randomly gain random alterations from a random list.

Maybe I've been looking at it all wrong... says the Dungeon Master, stroking his beard, "You sick people. You actually ENJOY this don't you? This is all game to you isn't it. Unbelievable. Well, I know exactly what will solve that problem!"
Empires are stabilised and vassals become content.

What is WRONG with you people!? screams the Dungeon Master, "Look at this person, this person RIGHT HERE" he says, gesturing to a perfectly normal person standing in your court. You don't recognise them but they certainly look very normal to you. "NOTHING at ALL looks strange about this person here?!" You gesture to your guards to have the Dungeon Master removed, clearly he has lost his mind.
My apologies my perfectly normal friend, welcome!
A perfectly normal person joins your court.

During routine maintenance in the temple of [fountain_of_youth_holding.GetName] in [fountain_of_youth_province.GetName] a great wellspring was discovered unlike any other - through the rockface beneath the foundation flows a seemingly unlimited source of crystal clear, glowing, water. Believing it to be a divine gift, the local ruler of the province bathed in the waters and drank deeply, only to discover that their strength grew rapidly and the ravages of time seemed to be reversed!\nThe local holy man has declared the site as sacred, with only the blessed ruler being allowed entrance into the divine fountain. Though for some jealous rulers perhaps, this may not be enough to prevent their curiosity...
The Fountain of Youth is discovered!
The owner of the province will occasionally gain health and grow younger!

Let me introduce you to my friend Gary. Gary loves playing my games, don't you Gary? asks the Dungeon Master as he slaps a timid and shellshocked man on the back, who in turn audibly squeaks. "See Gary has always dreamt big, but he never quite made it, so I'm going to let him live vicariously! Every court throughout the land will get their very own Gary, fruit directly from the loin's of Gary Prime!"\nSuddenly a nefarious looking copy of Gary pops into your court, "Buuuut..." continues the Dungeon Master, "These Gary's will be slightly amped up. Much more ambitious and skilled than the original, so watch your back!"

I basically only exist to watch the suffering of others, but you people just do suffering so much more efficiently. There are the occasional occasions where occasionally you do take things a bit too far. Ruin the fun entirely. Here. the Dungeon Master fishes around into his pocket before handing you a small paper card - 'Get out of Jail Free' is written on it, "Just so that the suffering isn't interrupted too much..."
All rulers gain a single-use 'Get Out of Jail Free' allowing for instant release from imprisonment.

The Dungeon Master appears looking pensive "I have no idea what this Gavelkind is but every time I bring it up you land owners always turn a funny colour." You feel your stomach turn at the sound of the forbidden word. "I've decided that a punishment for all those naughty rulers will be this 'Gavelkind' thing... whatever it is."
All characters with serious crimes such as ùPImpalersù! or ùRKinslayersù! will be forced into Gavelkind.

I've got plans today, can't do any of the usual evil! says the Dungeon Master, dashing through your court with a suitcase, "A Hotelier friend of mine gave me these tickets, claimed he was a huge fan of my work, but the hotel is all the way in the north west of Britainia, wherever that is. They're yours if you want them!"
You push yourself in a work out.

I was visiting a friend of mine and it turns out he had someone there that definitely fit in with his... regular crowd. Anyway he's far too nice to be left down there so I'm putting him under your care. He tells me he's quite talented!
A talented courtier arrives in your court who will produce happy little accidents while he's around.

I just found a brilliant new game to play! It's called EU4. You take control of a kingdom somewhere in the world, and then you 'paint the map' as all my friends would say. Would you like to give it a go?
I have a bad feeling about this...
playing a nice game of EU4 with the Dungeon Master.
playing a nice game of EU4 with the Dungeon Master, but you cant help but wonder why he's smirking...\n
All playable rulers are forced to play.
playing a nice game of EU4 with the Dungeon Master, and hope for the best...\n

It's always the same with you people begins a very judgemental Dungeon Master, "It's always genius, strong, fair, claims, whatever with you people, never what's on the INSIDE. And that's all that counts. Well, in hindsight, I guess genius is on the inside, now that I think about it... and claims too... Well don't think you're getting away with it that easily!"
Look, your other options are Scorpion rave, Lion rave, or Goat rave. I think your life expectancy is much better with this, trust me.
I am throwing the dice, let's see what you get..

So I've been reading some of the works of some fine lads called Charles Marks and Fred Angels, the Dungeon Master says, looking up from a little red book. "Their ideas of wealth redistrubution has given me an idea..."
All playable rulers will have their wealth taken from them and redistributed evenly. As a side note, the Dungeon Master doesn't know what 'redistributed' means.

Do you like chess? the Dungeon Master asks with a wide, sinister grin on his face. "I do! In fact, I love it so much that I've invited a friend over to play with me. I forgot to bring the chess pieces, but no matter! We'll be using you lot!"\nThe Dungeon Master scratches his chin in thought and smirks. "So, tell me, what colour do you like?"
This option is available because you are within diplomatic range of one of the Queens in this conflict.
This option is available because you are not within diplomatic range of one of the Queens in this conflict.

Two random rulers will become the White Queen and the Black Queen, and all other rulers around them will be their tributaries. The tributaries on the losing side will suffer dire consequences for their failure. Knight to King 4.

I simply adore animals! exclaims the Dungeon Master while playing around with a kitten, making it chase a peacock feather. "The tiny ones, the big ones, the ones with sharp teeth that will eviscerate you in a moments notice..." He looks up at you and smirks wildly. "Would you like your own pet? Only 50 coins, and it can be yours! And I promise it wont die!"
But you already sold me one before...
A randomly-chosen pet will appear on your character screen as a character modifier. All are permanent and beneficial.
All rulers will be given the option to buy a pet of their own.

I've recently come across seven strange men, the Dungeon Master quips. "They are a quirky bunch, all of them are dwarves, singing while they work in the salt mines. But they do seem lonely. They have expressed their desire to join the court of a delightfully-female ruler. Don't ask me how delightfully-female is different from regular female."
Seven dwarves? What is this, a fairy tale?
One playable female ruler in the world will receive a gift of seven dwarves of varying usefulness.

Family is the most important thing in the world, quips the Dungeon Master while stroking his chin. "But you also know what's just as important? Congenital traits and bloodlines. Trying to get them is such a hassle, so I'm going to be nice and let you kidnap any one child of your choosing."\nThe Dungeon Master lifts up a finger to silence your forthcoming questions, "There are stipulations, however. No rulers, no AI heirs, and no heirs of players unless they have a spare. Don't say I didn't do anything nice for you!"
You are given a single-use targeted decision against any child within diplomatic range. This child will move to your court and join your dynasty.
the prior liege of the child is notified

Humility is a weird concept, muses the Dungeon Master as he surveys the land. "I prefer fear when keeping people in line. Oh, and speaking of fear and humility..." The Dungeon Master grins from ear to ear and snaps his fingers.
A random independent ruler and one of their vassals will trade titles.

Everything is eerily silent. The leaves do not rustle in the wind, the birds are quiet, even your own footsteps as you walk into the forest grove are muted.
Before you is a woman with pale skin and raven black hair, dressed only in a robe that matches her hair color. The scythe she wields gives you no doubt as to her identity.

"Be not afraid, mortal," she speaks, nary an emotion crosses her lips, "you are fast asleep in the real world. I have come to offer you a deal." She extends a hand out, waiting for you to take it into yours. "I will grant you a longer lifespan, but in return you will die on a specific date."

Death is offering you a choice to live another 10 years as an exceptional [GetManWoman], 25 years as you are, or 50 as an inferior [GetManWoman]. But at the end of those years, Death will come back to claim you. This also does not prevent your death from the sword or the dagger.
Choose to live another 10 years in glory. After 10 years, you will die.
Choose to live another 25 years. After 25 years, you will die.
Choose to live another 50 years in mediocrity. After 50 years, you will die.
You wake up in bed. Was it just a dream, or was it real?
You find yourself back in the familiar forest grove, lit only by the full moon. "It is time, mortal," speaks the pale reaper. "Your time on this mortal world has come to an end."
It's a sad thing that your adventures have ended here.
People tell me I'm not kind, muses the Dungeon Master. "Well, I'll show them! BEHOLD! I shall grant a fourth of the populace the power of my dragon!"
Every playable ruler will have a 25% chance of getting a non-inheritable bloodline.

The DM appears before you with an animal cage in hand, looking worried. "I, uh..." he fidgets, "may have accidentally loosed some animals into the world. And given them sentience. And titles. Whoops."
An animal kingdom has appeared on the map.

5G! the Dungeon Master exclaims happily. "Such a wonderful technology! It was given to me by the Lizard People, and will prooooo-" he stops to clear his throat before continuing, "...prove to be a real game changer."

While walking through your demense one day, you come across the damnest sight: a herd of cows- all dressed like human laborers- building a giant metal tower of some kind. You suspect it's time to take up drinking as a hobbby.
This is such a mooving sight to see.
You are given this option because you are the Queen of England.
20 random rulers will have 1G towers build in their capital province.\nThese towers levy a hefty cost on the populace, but can be upgraded to reduce the penalties.\nßGYou were not chosen.ß!
20 random rulers will have 1G towers build in their capital province.\nThese towers levy a hefty cost on the populace, but can be upgraded to reduce the penalties.\nßRYou were chosen.ß!

No man is an island, entire of itself. Each is a piece of the continent, a part of the main. If a clod be washed away by the sea, Europe is the less. As well as if a promontory were. As well as if a manor of thine own or of thine friend's were. Each man's death diminishes me, for I am involved in mankind. Therefore, send not to know for whom the horn doots, It doots for thee.
You are granted a one-time useage of the Horn of Dootage during battle. From peasants to emperors, all tremble at the sound of the mighty doot doot!

The Dungeon Master suddenly appears in front of you looking exasperated and almost... scared? "Listen, these are your problem now," he begins, as he opens his hand revealing six bright stones of various colours, "Fight, bribe, kill each other over them - I don't care." He begins to run out of the room, but suddenly snaps back to face you. "Just don't let HIM get them."
All of that over brightly coloured rocks?
The ßBEternity Pebblesß! are now active in the world and have been randomly distributed to six rulers.
The ßBEternity Pebblesß! are artifacts of unrivaled power, and a ruler who collects all six will unlock a ßMunique decisionß!.
Owners of the ßBEternity Pebblesß! can be targeted by unique ßGCasus Beliß! by others attempting to gain the Pebbles.
Owners of the ßBEternity Pebblesß! may find themselves attracting the attention of an ßKunwanted guestß!...

Lately, your dog has been acting strangely. It has become overly violent and refuses to drink water. Just as you were taking it out for a morning stroll, the damned thing bit you! You can see the dog foaming at the mouth.
Oh no, this can't be good!

The Dungeon Master bursts into the room wearing various furs, including a canine headdress that would look more at home on a shaman. "Can I nuzzle wuzzle you? uwu you're so warm!" he says, playfully batting at you with his fake wolf paws. He suddenly sees a cat and starts chasing after it. "SNUGGLE WUGGLE!"

You walk up to the man, who has just arrived in your court and proclaim that you are going into battle, and require his strongest potions. "You don't know what you ask, traveler," he begins, "My strongest potions will kill a dragon, let alone a man. You need a seller that sells weaker potions, because my potions are too strong!"
No respect for anything... except your potions!
You take one of the potions despite the warning...

Well done, well done! exclaims the Dungeon Master, "you have all outdone yourselves again! Slaying, crushing, trampling, and impaling your way to victory, but of course the rules were whoever holds it now time is up! Congratulations to [winner_winner_chicken_meal.GetName]!
The ruler of [battle_royale.GetName] wins their victory purse.
The Midas Plague has struck me and my body has started turning into gold!
The Midas Plague takes part of your body!
Sipping from the Fountain of Youth

You visit the Fountain of Youth at the local temple where it was uncovered. As the ruler of the province the local holy man believes you to have a divine blessing and lets you into the fountain. You drink from the fountain and feel reinvigorated!
I can feel the years slipping away!
Empire of Gary has been formed by one ambitious Gary who rose above the rest! All Garys are rounded up and sent to the new Empire where it will stand, united in Garydom, for the rest of time!
Bob Ross, your local painter, gardener, and all round nice guy, has once again blessed your court with some kind gifts and warm feelings!

[dead_heir.GetHerHisCap] body has been draped, by whom you do not know, in a white cloth now stained red by [dead_heir.GetHerHis] lost vitae. They say [dead_heir.GetSheHe] was found by [dead_heir.GetHerHis] horse, in a clearing in the woods. You know the place they speak of. [dead_heir.GetHerHisCap] face is calm, almost serene. You reach out to touch [dead_heir.GetHerHim]. The terrible reality of the situation dawns on you. The cold you feel is that of death.

[current_heir.GetSheHeCap] limps back from the hunt, ribs shattered and every breath a painful struggle. Bruised and battered, [current_heir.GetSheHe] appears on the horizon, blood staining on [current_heir.GetHerHis] torn garments. A stark reminder that even the heir of your house is not invincible.
I cannot bare the idea of losing [current_heir.GetFirstName].
A child, [dm_kidnapped.GetFirstName], has been kidnapped from your very court by the sinister [dm_kidnapper.GetTitledName]!:

With the completion of the 5G tower, the plans of the Lizard People have finally come to fruition!

GENTLEMEN, BEHOLD!

BOVID-19!
The 5G tower explodes in a burst of energy, leaving behind a new and frightening disease.

Your cursed ring has imbued you with all sorts of power, and through it you have achieved great feats of glory. But some days a great whisper rattles in your skull and its lure is almost too difficult to resist.
You feel as if you will not be able to resist the whispers any longer.

The whispers become all too much to bear. You collapse to your knees and cough up a pitch black fog which begins to engulf you. A face fills your mind, the face of the one who gifted you this ring all that time ago...
Oh dear. It seems [dm_dead_dooter.GetFirstNameWithNick] has dooted [dm_dead_dooter.GetHerHis] last doot. On the bright side, [dm_dead_dooter.GetSheHe] had a stockpile of calcium you inherited.

Having suffered the constant dark words in your mind for too long you grab at your finger and yank the ring from it with all of your might. Though it grips to your skin at first, eventually the ring relents, and with a solid thud, it hits the ground.
I will put this away, but perhaps not too far.
You successfully remove the ring, though you could wear it again at any time.

In a mad fit of desperation you take hold of the cursed ring that sits on your finger and try to pull it off with all of your strength. Thought you try with all your might, you find yourself thinking... it is your ring. Afterall, why shouldn't you keep it? It has already gotten you so far!
Silly me, what was I thinking?
Characters with more morally good traits, and self-control, will have a higher chance of the resisting the ring!
The Dungeon Master will cycle through six events before previously-seen events will be available again.
The Dungeon Master will cycle through twelve events before previously-seen events will be available again.
The Dungeon Master will cycle through three events before previously-seen events will be available again.
The Dungeon Master will cause chaos roughly once every 15 years.
The Dungeon Master will give the world time to breathe by causing chaos roughly once every thirty years.
The Dungeon Master just wants to see the world burn with events happening roughly every five years.
Events have no minimum time and could fire randomly!
Current milk: [current_milk.GetValue]/[max_milk.GetValue]\nMilk is regained little by little each year.
This character forgot to wear a mask out in public and has contracted BOVID-19. On the bright side, their milk is delicious.
5G towers have unleashed the power of BOVID-19 in this province.
